arts.ttl: Ruben Selles questions big Swansea City flashpoint as Hull City fall to damaging defeat
arts.sum: In truth, Selles' men were well below-par in a drab first half, offering little in the final third but the decision early in the second period changed the course of the game, and though the Tigers boss disagreed with the referee, he was more concerned with the poor display in the opening 45 minutes. While City defended well in the first period, limiting the hosts to shots from distance, up the other end, Selles' side were limp and offered nothing, a situation which did improve in the second period when he sent on Abu Kamara, Nordin Amrabat and Crooks.

arts.ttl: The two big calls that decided Swansea City's win over Hull City as 17-year record broken
arts.sum: Swansea edged their way to a deserved, but somewhat controversial 1-0 win over Hull City

arts.ttl: Controversial penalty sees Hull City suffer major setback at Swansea City
arts.sum: City were a goal behind early in the second half yet again, but this time, it was from a penalty that should never have been given when the ball appeared to hit John Egan in the face, but fussy referee Ben Toner, after an age, pointed to the spot and from that kick, Zan Vipotnik sent Ivor Pandur the wrong way. No more than three minutes were on the clock when Sean McLoughlin was booked for a rash challenge on Ronald on the right flank, and referee Ben Toner wasted no time in handed out his 168th yellow card of the campaign and he was soon followed by a needless clip of the heels from Joe Gelhardt, who collected card 169 of a prolific campaign for the man in the middle before Joe Allen joined the club for a foul on Puerta.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings as Tigers face more relegation stress after referee howler
arts.sum: Zan Vipotnik's controversial penalty early in the second half condemned Hull City to a defeat which leaves them perched just two points above the bottom three with three games left. Ruben Selles' men were below-par in a poor first half, but will point to the penalty which changed the game and how it saw his side beaten by that goal, and now, attention turns to that huge visit of Preston North End on Monday.

arts.ttl: Swansea add to Hull’s relegation fears with controversial penalty
arts.sum: Zan Vipotnik scored the only goal before the Tigers finished with 10 men.

arts.ttl: Blackburn Rovers, Hull City among clubs eyeing out-of-contract QPR defender
arts.sum: QPR defender Morgan Fox is attracting interest from Blackburn Rovers, Hull City and Millwall, reporter Graeme Bailey has… The post Blackburn Rovers, Hull City among clubs eyeing out-of-contract QPR defender appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: O'Brien opens door to Swansea return next season
arts.sum: Lewis O'Brien says he would "definitely" be open to re-joining Swansea City next season if the Championship club were to agree a deal with Nottingham Forest.

arts.ttl: Hull City told what key ingredient is needed for Championship survival
arts.sum: Ruben Selles' men battled back from the setback of conceding a second own goal in four games against the Sky Blues, before fighting back to earn a big point courtesy of Abu Kamara's finish, a response which impressed Boateng . He believes the biggest positive going into their Good Friday game was the fact Selles' men battled back to get a point.

arts.ttl: Drameh starts: Hull City team news and predicted XI to face Swansea City
arts.sum: Hull City are back in Championship action on Friday afternoon with an away trip to Swansea City in… The post Drameh starts: Hull City team news and predicted XI to face Swansea City appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: Hull City are two matches away from Ruben Selles' dream Championship scenario
arts.sum: Should they find a way to get two wins over this weekend, and the Bluebirds were to lose at Sheffield United on Friday and then lose at home to a resurgent Oxford United side, with Luton and Plymouth dropping points, then their safety would be confirmed before that visit of Derby County and then what at this stage, looks a daunting trip to Fratton Park on the final day. The Easter weekend often goes a long way to dictating what happens in the final reckoning, and it will be no different this year with only two games left once it's come and gone.
